item.title: Building an Excavator H-Link From Scratch
item.description: Part two of building an excavator H-link from raw materials, focusing on precision and fit. What challenges come with fabricating heavy-duty components?

media:content.media:title: Building an Excavator H-Link From Scratch
media:content.media:description: Part two of building an excavator H-link from raw materials, focusing on precision and fit. What challenges come with fabricating heavy-duty components?

item.title: Repairing a Worn Motor Grader Circle
item.description: A damaged and worn motor grader circle is inspected and addressed through careful machining work. What causes this kind of wear over time?

item.title: Completing a Custom Fume Extraction System
item.description: The final steps in building a fume extraction system designed to improve safety and air quality in the workshop. How does a setup like this change daily work?

item.title: A Special Visit to the Workshop
item.description: A well-known maker stopped by the workshop to talk tools, projects, and craftsmanship. What happens when creative minds meet on the shop floor?

item.title: Troubleshooting a Suspension Strut Repair
item.description: A routine suspension strut repair didn’t go exactly as planned, leading to careful adjustments and problem-solving. How do small issues affect the final result?

item.title: Building a Shop-Made Rolling Tool
item.description: See how a custom rolling tool is designed and built in the workshop to solve a practical machining need. Why build your own tool instead of buying one?

item.title: When a 150-Tonne Jacking Cylinder Fails
item.description: A heavy-duty jacking cylinder failed during a job, prompting a closer look at what went wrong and how it’s addressed. What lessons come from working at this scale?

item.title: A New Piston Takes Shape Inside a Hydraulic Cylinder
item.description: Watch the careful process of designing and fitting a new piston for a hydraulic cylinder, from precision measurements to smooth assembly. How does one component make such a difference in performance?

item.title: Testing a Custom Nudge Bar Design
item.description: A custom nudge bar build put to the test reveals why the design still needs refinement. Follow the engineering process behind evaluating form, function, and durability. What would you change in the next version?

item.title: Precision Line-Boring a Massive Mining A-Frame
item.description: Watch the careful process of line-boring a giant mining truck A-frame, where accuracy is critical for long-term performance. Every measurement matters at this scale. How precise does it need to be?

item.title: How Cylinder Parts Are Tested for Cracks
item.description: An inside look at dye penetrant testing used to detect hidden cracks in hydraulic cylinder components. This precise method helps ensure reliability and safety in heavy machinery. What signs would you look for first?

item.title: Caterpillar D10 Equalizer Bar Crack Explained
item.description: A closer look at a crack found in the equalizer bar of a Caterpillar D10 bulldozer, what may cause this kind of damage, and why it matters for machine performance and safety. What would you inspect next?

item.title: Franna Crane Run with 6BT Power
item.description: Watch a Franna crane in operation, powered by a 6BT engine, handling a routine lift with steady control and efficiency. How does engine performance shape safe and reliable crane work?

item.title: Using Liquid Nitrogen for a Precision Fit
item.description: A controlled look at how liquid nitrogen is used to install components with tight tolerances, and how careful planning helps avoid setbacks during the process. What makes temperature control so critical here?

item.title: Feller Buncher Dipper Arm Repair
item.description: Follow a step-by-step repair of a feller buncher dipper arm, focusing on diagnosis, welding, and proper alignment to restore reliable operation in the field. What does it take to keep heavy forestry equipment working safely?

item.title: Repairing Parts for a 2,000 HP Engine
item.description: A behind-the-scenes look at repairing critical components designed for a 2,000 horsepower engine, highlighting craftsmanship and engineering standards. What goes into keeping engines of this scale running?

item.title: Metal Spray Repair on a CAT Crank Pulley
item.description: This video shows how metal spray repair is used to restore a CAT engine crank pulley, focusing on precision, process, and durability. How do repairs like this extend engine life?

item.title: Hydraulic Cylinder Tear-Down and Custom Spanner Build
item.description: Watch a complete hydraulic cylinder tear-down and the fabrication of a custom flogging spanner to assist with the job. This video focuses on tool creation and mechanical disassembly techniques. Do you prefer building your own specialized tools for tough jobs?

item.title: Custom Welding Upgrade for Enhanced Workshop Utility
item.description: Improve your workspace efficiency with this custom welding upgrade designed for professional workshops. This video showcases the fabrication steps taken to modernize a standard setup for better results. What is the next major upgrade you have planned for your shop?

item.title: Machining a New Barrel for a 10-Ton Forklift Cylinder
item.description: Follow the repair process for a 10-ton forklift hydraulic cylinder, including the machining of a brand-new barrel. This project combines lathe work and welding to restore essential lifting hardware. How often do you perform maintenance on your hydraulic systems?
